chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Burton Somers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Counts 5 & 6, and any other existing sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:20 PM: Defendant Richard Burton Somers in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court for Richard Burton Somers. Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Counts 4, 5, & 6 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 1, 2, 3, & 7 - DRI. Statement by DE. As to Counts 4 & 6 - Court orders: S/W - 3 years probation. As to Count 5 - Count orders: S/W - 2 years probation concurrent to Counts 4 & 6. Conditions: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Paul Edward Zilles appeared by phone for Richard Burton Somers.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zilles is requesting a FPT. The Court orders defense final pre-trial motions due by August 1, 2022, State's due by August 15, 2022.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Case called @ 2:48 PM Defendant Richard Burton Somers in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court for Richard Burton Somers.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Jesse Gilchrist sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by ADA Ryan. Witness identifies Defendant in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Zilles. Witness excused. The Court finds probable cause exists. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered as to all counts. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by ADA Kottke.
